meanings.definition: To strike or hit with the hand or a weapon.
meanings.sent1: She paiks the drum with her hands.
meanings.sent2: He paiks the nail with a hammer.
meanings.sent3: The chef paiks the dough to make it flat.
meanings.sent4: The storm paiks the trees with fierce winds.
meanings.sent5: The teacher paiks the board to get the students' attention.

meanings.sent1: The boxer delivered a powerful paiks to his opponent.
meanings.sent2: The paiks on the door startled me.
meanings.sent3: The unexpected paiks on the window made everyone jump.
meanings.sent4: The thunder sounded like a series of paiks in the distance.
meanings.sent5: The paiks of the drum echoed through the room.

meanings.sent1: The parent paiks the child for misbehaving.
meanings.sent2: The teacher paiks the student for cheating.
meanings.sent3: The coach paiks the team with extra drills for losing the game.
meanings.sent4: The judge paiks the criminal with a heavy sentence.
meanings.sent5: The supervisor paiks the employee for being late.
